summary:
Rational numbers are fractions made from two integers, like 3/4 or 7. They are a type of real number. You can spot rational numbers by their repeating or ending decimal patterns, like 0.75 or 0.20454545...

These numbers are countable and form a field, meaning they can be added and multiplied. They are also dense within the real numbers, meaning they can get arbitrarily close to any real number.
title: Rational number
